conclusion: To determine the trend of acceleration of object B, analyze the velocity-time graph.
Graph shows velocity on y-axis and time on x-axis; object B's velocity changes over time.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time, given by a = dv/dt.
On a velocity-time graph, the slope of the tangent at any point gives the instantaneous acceleration.
At t = 0, velocity of object B is positive and increasing; slope is positive, indicating positive acceleration.
As t increases from 0 to t1, velocity decreases then increases; slope becomes negative then positive, indicating negative then positive acceleration.
At t = t2, velocity of object B is positive and increasing; slope is positive, indicating positive acceleration.
From t = 0 to t1, acceleration changes from positive to negative and back to positive.
From t = t1 to t2, acceleration remains positive.
Trend of acceleration of object B during 0 to t2 is initially positive, then negative, and finally positive again.
